title: Commission Regulation (EC) No 502/94 of 7 March 1994 determining the loss of income and the premiums applicable per ewe and per female goat in the Member States for the 1993 marketing year
header:
COMMISSION REGULATION (EC) No 502/94 of 7 March 1994 determining the loss of income and the premiums applicable per ewe and per female goat in the Member States for the 1993 marketing year
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: It is hereby noted that the difference between the basic price less the impact of the coefficient provided for in Article 8 (2) of Regulation (EEC) No 3013/89 and the Community market price during the 1993 marketing year was ECU 130,610 per  100 kilograms.
The coefficient provided for in Article 5 (2) of Regulation (EEC) No 3013/89 is hereby fixed at 16 kilograms.

1. The premium payable per ewe in respect of the 1993 marketing year shall be as follows:
"(ECU)"" ID="1">20,898> ID="2">16,718">
2. The premium payable per female of the caprine species and per region in areas listed in Annex I to Regulation (EEC) No 3013/89 and in Article 1 of Regulation (EEC) No 1065/86 in respect of the 1993 marketing year shall be as follows:
(ECU)
Premium payable per female of the caprine species
16,718

Pursuant to Article 13 (3) of Regulation (EEC) No 1601/92, the supplement to the premium for the 1993 marketing year to be granted to producers of light lambs and female goats located in the Canary Islands, within the limits and at the rates  laid down in Article 5 (7) and the second indent of the second subparagraph, of Article 5 (8) of Regulation (EEC) No 3013/89 shall be as follows:
- ECU 5,880 per ewe in the case of producers as referred to in Article 5 (3) of that Regulation,
- ECU 5,880 per female goat in the case of producers as referred to in Article 5 (5) of that Regulation.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the seventh day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
